poem:
### The Silent Court

A father stands,  
his words swallowed  
by fate's quiet verdict.  
Science speaks—no more  
than echoes in a hollow  
room. Cold gavel,  
and a child's whisper  
caught between truth  
and shadows.  
Time stretches on,  
a tethered breath,  
awaiting justice  
or the light of dawn's  
unraveling hope.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Roberson, 57, brought his daughter Nikki Curtis to hospital in Palestine, Texas, on 31 January 2002. He told doctors that she was ill with fever and had fallen". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
